subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Unicode Status
msgSnippet: ... Meaning they have learnt nothing from the Coptic affair! They should clearly have unified also Latin and Cyrillic with Greek, of which they both are mere
messageBody:
2013-04-16 17:54, Michael Everson skrev:
> You will, orthographically. But I can't say that I believe that there is any chance whatsoever that the UCS will have both Shavian and Quikscript as two separate scripts.

Meaning they have learnt nothing from the Coptic affair!

They should clearly have unified also Latin and
Cyrillic with Greek, of which they both are mere
variants, and surely the separate encoding of three
Georgian alphabets and their disunification from
Armenian was a mistake since the three are clearly only
glyph variants and since some claim that both the
Georgian and Armenian alphabets were designed by the
same man, St. Mesrop, not to mention the obviously
isosystemic katakana and hiragana, or the various
Brahmic scripts -- eh glyph variants -- which you did
already mention yourself!

Are they running out of codepoints, or what?

/bpj
